reviews.content: Sweet and largely balanced, the oak does tend to come out ever so slightly on the palate.
reviews.nose: Subtle, gentle and polished, this leaves a very creamy, custard-esque first impression with an indubitable orange-y element. More like candy oranges than the fragrant oils from an actual orange peel, but pleasant nonetheless. Then a soft note of underripe bananas and jammy apricots.
reviews.taste: Bottled at 40 per cent but a somewhat buttery texture still. I was going to write cloves and oranges, but I might as well say orange pomander – not that I’ve ever eaten one. Anyway, a slight oaky bitterness as well, followed by a touch of ginger and a hint of shortbread.
reviews.finish: Short to medium. Creamy vanilla, a touch of grain and somewhat leafy.

reviews.nose: Mild. Butter cookies, a hint of honey, a touch of vanilla. Dried mint. Sawdust.
reviews.taste: Light. Butter cookies. Bright grapes, a hint of peach. Walnut. Cocoa nibs.

reviews.nose: Lavender, malt, honey, mint, light fruit
reviews.taste: Sweet, a little ginger, malt, spicy, sparkling

reviews.content: A simple whisky for every day.
reviews.nose: Fresh. Simple. Refreshing. Pleasant. Apple. Pear. Orange peel. Lemon peel. Vanilla. Honey. Minerality.
reviews.taste: Orange. Pear and apple. Vanilla. Honey. Cream. Flowers appear, meadow. Delicate spices.
reviews.finish: The sweetness of the fruit quickly fades. Bourbon and floral notes remain. Dryness appears. Oak. Pepper.

reviews.taste: Vanilla cream, malt grain, fruit/leather spice, sweet, and fun.

reviews.content: Satisfying at 40% ABV. Matured in 1-st and 2-nd fill American white oak ex-bourbon casks. Chill-filtered. Coloured. Slowly forming straight primary legs. Thick slow secondary legs. Droplets.
reviews.nose: Fruity: citrus: orange; fresh fruit: apple, pear, quince; stone fruit: peach, apricot, dark cherry; tropical fruit: overripe banana. Cereal: barley malt, hay, sweat bread, grain. Floral: heather, lemongrass, fragrant. Spicy: pepper, mint, baking spices, cinnamon, clove, tea. Sweet: honey, caramel, vanilla, orange chocolate. Woody: toasted oak, oak spices. Nutty: almond. Earthy: must. Herbal: leaves, grass, straw. Oily: cream. Rich: crisp, clean. Full body: balanced, delicate. Water pushes up fruity notes.
reviews.taste: Sweet: honey, vanilla, toffee, caramel, maple syrup; Fruity: fresh fruit: apple, pear, quince; citrus: orange, lemon, tangerine; stone fruit: peach. Maritime: salted caramel. Spicy: pepper, cinnamon. Woody: white oak. Nutty. Cereal: malt. Floral. Herbal: leaves, delicate herbs. Oily: cream, mouth coating, dairy note. Full body: balanced, fresh. Rich. Water extends the development.
reviews.finish: Long. Sweet: honey, vanilla, caramel. Oily: cream. Woody: oak. Nutty. Spicy: pepper, clove, baking spices, salted caramel. Fruity: citrus: ripe orange; candied fruit. Cereal. Full body: satisfying. Water pushes up sweet and fruity notes.

reviews.content: In the context of a 12-year old 40% it is good, actually better than Glenlivet 12, a notch lower than Glenffidich 12.Notes are simple yet fruity and vanilla all over. Being part of LVMH makes it great addition to your Ardbegs to start a flight with it.

Great! I don't miss any of the elegance and vibrancy of the old 10-year-old; I even think the extra two years suit it well. In my opinion, this is probably the best starting point for anyone who wants to get to know whisky.
reviews.nose: Initially, it arrives surprisingly quickly, with crème brûlée and orange peel at the forefront. After the alcohol evaporates, softer aromas of vanilla, ripe summer fruits and golden kiwi emerge, with a very delicate wood spice in the background.
reviews.taste: Wonderfully clean, with honey, orange, and malt sweetness, then developing into an ethereal, aromatic, floral, and tropical aroma. It's a good wine for its 40% ABV, very flattering.
reviews.finish: The palate doesn't linger long, leading into a smooth, elegant finish. Summer blossoms, citrus zest, and lychee linger on the palate, fading with a slight dryness.

reviews.content: Nice nose. Good for beginners. Nothing extra for experienced whisky drinkers.

Aroma: Sweet and gentle, with clear notes of vanilla, honey, and green fruits, apples and pears, followed by peach, orange, and delicate hints of caramelTaste: Exceptionally smooth and beautifully fruity, peach and orange come through clearly, accompanied by a distinct vanilla sweetness and a subtle hint of cake, the finish is gentle and creamy, vanilla fruity in character, with a pleasantly spicy touch at the endOverall Impression: A very pleasantly surprising whisky, the price is highly attractive considering the quality, making this an ideal whisky for beginners
Kind on a sweet side. A lot of peach with a hint of honey and pear. And much less floral if compared to 10 year version.
Not a fan. Hints of pineapple, lemon on the nose, but the taste is rather weak for that kind of price.

reviews.nose: Dark chocolate, stone fruit(apricot or peach), orange peel, nuts(not as dry as almond or walnut, more like pistachio?), grape, a little bit of petrol
reviews.taste: spicy(not like pepper spicy, more like dried red pepper or sth), milk chocolate, very oaky(personally doesn't prefer morangie's oaky taste. So it could be over estimated),
reviews.finish: short Finish. grape, spicy, a lttle bit of cucumber or oriental melon or unriped melon.

reviews.content: Lekkere en toegankelijk whisky waar de sinaasappel goed merkbaar is met een prettige nasmaak van carameltonen
